name: Permethrin

ingredients.name: CARBOMER HOMOPOLYMER TYPE B (ALLYL PENTAERYTHRITOL OR ALLYL SUCROSE CROSSLINKED)

indications.text: permethrin cream , 5 % indicated treatment infestation sarcoptes scabiei ( scabies ) .

contraindications.text: adults children thoroughly massage permethrin cream , 5 % skin head soles feet . scabies rarely infests scalp adults , although hairline , neck , temple , forehead may infested infants geriatric patients . usually 30 grams sufficient average adult . cream removed washing ( shower bath ) 8 14 hours . infants treated scalp , temple , forehead . one application generally curative . patients may experience persistent pruritus treatment . rarely sign treatment failure indication retreatment . demonstrable living mites 14 days indicate retreatment necessary .

warningsAndPrecautions: permethrin cream , 5 % ( w/w ) available follows : 60 g tube ( ndc 16714-897-01 )
adverseReactions: permethrin cream , 5 % contraindicated patients known hypersensitivity components , synthetic pyrethroid pyrethrin .
indications_original: Permethrin Cream, 5% is indicated for the treatment of infestation with Sarcoptes scabiei (scabies).
contraindications_original:
Adults and children
                  
                  Thoroughly massage Permethrin Cream, 5% into the skin from the head to the soles of the feet. Scabies rarely infests the scalp of adults, although the hairline, neck, temple, and forehead may be infested in infants and geriatric patients.  Usually 30 grams is sufficient for an average adult. The cream should be removed by washing (shower or bath) after 8 to 14 hours.  Infants should be treated on the scalp, temple, and forehead. ONE APPLICATION IS GENERALLY CURATIVE.
                  
                  Patients may experience persistent pruritus after treatment. This is rarely a sign of treatment failure and is not an indication for retreatment. Demonstrable living mites after 14 days indicate that retreatment is necessary.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Permethrin Cream, 5% (w/w) is available as follows:
                  60 g tube (NDC 16714-897-01)
adverseReactions_original: Permethrin Cream, 5% is contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to any of its components, to any synthetic pyrethroid or pyrethrin.
